item.title: 3D Digitized Humans
item.description: We've been tinkering lately with taking pictures for the Open Crowd Project, an effort to create a 3D printed crowd of humanoids. It really doesn't take much effort, nor much equipment. You just submit a series of photos of your model (photo guidelines), upload them to the project, and sit …
item.dc:creator: berticus

item.title: Hacks/Hackers Rochester
item.description: A few Wednesdays ago, after a long and cozy day of working from home, I decided to break my "never leave the house or have meaningful human contact" rule, and I ventured out to the snowy tundra of Henrietta. The threshold for this odd behavior is quite high, but I …

item.title: BarCamp Plot-chester
item.description: As is usually the case, Interlock managed to cajole/bribe the organizers of BarCamp Rochester into giving us a table in the atrium, upon which we could set up our wares and lure in unsuspecting geeks. The conference itself was really great, with lots of interesting talks, and lots of …
item.dc:creator: berticus

item.title: Docubot Hands-free Camera
item.description:
Surely this will be my last poorly documented project: a hands-free foot operated documentation camera. I thought it'd be handy, and I had an old broken desk lamp kicking around, so of course, the two must be mushed together.

I started out with an old Canon SD1000, with CHDK installed …
item.dc:creator: berticus

item.title: Plottopotamus
item.description: I've been taking up quite a bit of space at Interlock lately with my new toy, a Roland DPX-3300 pen plotter... delivered via ebay from the magical futurepast of the early nineties. For those that are out of the loop with the past century, pen plotters are two axis robo-thingamajigs …
item.dc:creator: berticus

item.title: November Lightning Talks
item.description: Join us this Friday, November 12th at 8pm for another stimulating night of lightning talks at Interlock! Lightning talks are five minute(-ish) presentations on whatever topic you're passionate about, and we try to get through fifteen or twenty of them in a night. The event is free and open …
item.dc:creator: berticus

item.title: Rochester 2600: Lock Pick Village
item.description: This Friday, November 5th, Rochester 2600 will once again occupy the halls of Interlock for its monthly meeting. The topic du jour will be lock picking, with an introductory presentation from AntiTree. There will be pick sets and several types of locks on hand, so come learn a few new …

item.title: Electronics Class Recap
item.description:
In addition to being our weekly open night, last Tuesday was the first of five classes providing an introduction to electronic components, circuits, and methods. Attendance was great, and gratitude goes to our intrepid instructor, Carl, who did an excellent job of explaining these concepts for the layperson.

Interlock would …

item.title: Rochester Security Summit 2010
item.description: The Strathallan Hotel will be home to Rochester Security Summit 2010, taking place October 20th and 21st. This year's theme is Emerging Threats, and will feature presentations from keynote speaker Stephen Northcutt, Rapid7 security consultant Joshua D. Abraham, Security Justice host Matt Neely, and DC585 organizer and friend of Interlock …

item.title: Hello World.
item.description:
It's true. We're starting up a hackerspace in Rochester, New York. Please check out our Meetup page if you're already convinced you need to join us.

For everybody else, the about page is a good place to get up to speed with what's going on. In summary: we're creating a …
